Il Governo della Serbia ha approvato la decisione di costituire una task force per negoziare e definire l’attuazione del progetto di costruzione della strada statale di prima categoria Vožd Karađorđe. La decisione, firmata il 2 ottobre dal Primo Ministro Đuro Macut, prevede che il gruppo collabori con il potenziale contraente per definire il valore delle prestazioni e dei lavori, nonché gli elementi essenziali in vista della stipula del contratto commerciale. A capo dell’unità è stato nominato Miroslav Alempić, viceministro facente funzione presso il Ministero delle Costruzioni, dei Trasporti e delle Infrastrutture, affiancato da altri 12 membri.  

Ricordiamo che l’aggiudicatario dei lavori per la Vožd Karađorđe – annunciata nel 2019 in occasione dell’inaugurazione del tratto autostradale Miloš Veliki da Obrenovac a Ljig – non è ancora stato selezionato. Inizialmente presentata come autostrada, secondo le parole del Presidente serbo Aleksandar Vučić essa avrebbe dovuto collegare la Šumadija con la Serbia orientale. Il progetto prevede una superstrada di circa 164 km da Lazarevac a Bor, con due corsie per senso di marcia, tre gallerie, oltre 130 ponti e 21 svincoli. L’investimento è stimato in 1 miliardo di euro. Nell’ottobre scorso, Vučić aveva affermato di attendersi l’avvio dei lavori per l’estate successiva. Come riportato da ekapija.com, questo progetto rappresenta un’opportunità interessante per imprese italiane specializzate nel settore delle infrastrutture stradali e delle grandi opere.

title_en: 5G network in Serbia to be functional from December – Telekom receives US loan for financing, tender for additional stations to follow
title_it: 5G in Serbia: attivazione a dicembre con finanziamento USA
content_en: (Photo: Pixabay.com/F. Muhammad) Telekom Srbija CEO Vladimir Lucic said that he expected to sign an arrangement with the US Exim Bank for financing the 5G network in Serbia by the end of November and that the loan would have more favorable terms than they would have gotten from commercial banks. He stated during a guest appearance on RTS that this would be the first agreement that a European telecommunications operator signed with that American financial institution, and the second in the world. – This means direct support from the US state, American institutions for the development of the 5G network, and we use a lot of American products in our system, from IBM to Microsoft. Exim Bank will actually provide extremely favorable loans, much more favorable than commercial loans – said Lucic. According to him, both European and American financial institutions are ready to help Telekom in the development of the 5G network, and their goal is for it to become functional in December . The company’s CEO said that the foundation of the infrastructure had been laid that would allow users to immediately see 5G in large cities and that, as soon as the license was obtained, people would see 5G on their phones . – We are now announcing a tender for additional stations that we will deploy. In the first two years, we will cover a significant part of Serbia with a 5G network. The goal is to fully cover the whole of Serbia by the end of 2027 – said Lucic. Speaking about Telekom’s operations in Kosovo, Lucic added that the company had launched an initiative to obtain a third mobile telephony license, for which it expected great support from the US. – Although we had excellent relations with the previous administration, two years ago the key contributions of the US ambassador in Pristina and Belgrade were to prevent (Kosovo Prime Minister Albin) Kurti from disconnecting MTS. We explained in a fairly argumentative way why that point of the Brussels Agreement should be fulfilled and MTS should be given a third license – said Lucic. He also added that the branch there covered 30,000 households with internet, landline, mobile telephony and television. – We pointed out to the American administration that before Kurti’s administration we had had no problems, that previous administrations had even had understanding for our company. I hope that in the formation of the new government, Kurti’s administration will not be so strong anymore, because it obviously has no understanding, nor does it want to approach the Serbian people. Its goal is to deport the Serbian people. It seems to me that, especially in the American administration, information about the harmfulness of Kurti’s actions is becoming clearer – said Lucic. Fotografije: Telekom Srbija a.d. Beograd Telekom Srbija Exim bank USA Vladimir Lučić 5G network US loan third license in KiM Your comment Send
content_it:
Il CEO di Telekom Srbija, Vladimir Lučić, ha dichiarato di attendersi la firma entro novembre di un accordo con la Export-Import Bank degli Stati Uniti (Exim Bank) per finanziare la rete 5G in Serbia. Il prestito offrirà condizioni più vantaggiose rispetto a quelle delle banche commerciali. Come riportato da ekapija.com, si tratterebbe del primo accordo tra un operatore telefonico europeo e questa istituzione finanziaria statunitense, e solo del secondo a livello mondiale. Lučić ha sottolineato il sostegno diretto delle istituzioni americane allo sviluppo del 5G in Serbia, evidenziando l’ampio utilizzo di prodotti statunitensi nel sistema, da IBM a Microsoft.

L’obiettivo è rendere la rete 5G operativa già a dicembre. La base infrastrutturale è già stata realizzata per permettere agli utenti delle grandi città di visualizzare immediatamente il 5G sui propri dispositivi non appena verrà rilasciata la licenza. A breve sarà pubblicato un bando per l’installazione di ulteriori stazioni: nei primi due anni verrà coperta una parte significativa del territorio serbo, con l’obiettivo di estendere la copertura a tutta la Serbia entro la fine del 2027.

Lučić ha inoltre annunciato che Telekom Srbija sta cercando di ottenere la terza licenza per la telefonia mobile in Kosovo, con il sostegno atteso dagli Stati Uniti. Ha ricordato il ruolo chiave svolto due anni fa dagli ambasciatori americani a Pristina e Belgrado nel convincere il primo ministro kosovaro Albin Kurti a non disconnettere MTS (Telekom Srbija), sottolineando che l’azienda forniva già servizi a 30.000 famiglie. Lučić ha espresso critiche verso l’attuale amministrazione kosovara, accusata di perseguire politiche ostili nei confronti della comunità serba.

L’implementazione del 5G in Serbia, con il sostegno finanziario e tecnologico statunitense, potrebbe offrire opportunità per aziende italiane operanti nel settore delle telecomunicazioni, in particolare per fornitori di infrastrutture, componentistica e servizi tecnologici complementari.

title_en: MK Group considering building new Carnex factory – Investment worth EUR 90 million
title_it: Nuovo impianto Carnex da 90 milioni
content_en: (Photo: Jelena Đelić) MK Group is considering building a new factory within the Carnex company, in which around EUR 90 million would be invested, announced the group’s CEO Mihailo Jankovic. – That would be a huge investment. Carnex’s factories were built in the 1960s and we have exhausted the possibilities for optimization. We have implemented new strategies and are now close to deciding to invest in a completely new factory. The value of the investment would be around EUR 90 million – said Jankovic at a panel at the Consumer Rules Summit 2025 regional conference in Tivat. When asked what the deciding factor is when it comes to such large investments, Jankovic is clear: – It’s always the return on invested money and energy - whether it is better to invest in that project or in another one. He said that MK Group was already looking towards 2029, because the company’s strategic plans had been defined by that time. Speaking about investment decisions, Jankovic said that, in MK Group, every idea was thoroughly considered within the team: – We discuss it thoroughly within the team and come to a common solution. We had a big discussion about an alcohol factory, which is an investment of EUR 42 million – said Jankovic. Fotografije: +1 MK Group Carnex Mihailo Janković construction of new factory within Carnex Carnex new factory Your comment Send
content_it: MK Group sta valutando la costruzione di un nuovo stabilimento per la sua controllata Carnex, con un investimento previsto di circa 90 milioni di euro. Lo ha annunciato l’amministratore delegato del gruppo, Mihailo Jankovic, nel corso del summit regionale “Consumer Rules 2025” a Tivat. “Si tratterebbe di un investimento molto rilevante. Gli attuali stabilimenti di Carnex risalgono agli anni ’60 e abbiamo ormai esaurito le possibilità di ottimizzazione. Abbiamo introdotto nuove strategie e siamo ormai prossimi a decidere di investire in uno stabilimento completamente nuovo”, ha dichiarato Jankovic. Interpellato sui criteri alla base di simili decisioni, ha sottolineato che “il fattore decisivo è sempre il ritorno sull’investimento di capitale ed energie: se sia meglio investire in questo progetto o in un altro”. Jankovic ha inoltre rivelato che il gruppo sta già pianificando fino al 2029, avendo definito i propri obiettivi strategici fino a quella data. Riguardo al processo decisionale, ha spiegato che ogni idea viene approfondita all’interno del team: “Ne discutiamo approfonditamente e giungiamo a una soluzione condivisa. Abbiamo avuto un ampio dibattito, ad esempio, sull’impianto per la produzione di alcol, un investimento da 42 milioni di euro”, ha aggiunto. Come riportato da ekapija.com, tale potenziale investimento potrebbe aprire opportunità per fornitori italiani di impianti e tecnologie per l’industria alimentare.

title_en: Tehnomanija arrives on Wolt – New partnership for faster and easier electronics shopping
title_it: Elettronica su Wolt con Tehnomanija
content_en: (Photo: Wolt) Faster and simpler electronics shopping via the Wolt app - a step closer to Wolt’s vision of a digital shopping mall Wolt, a company developing the leading digital delivery platform in Serbia, announces a partnership that brings users a completely new electronics shopping experience. The latest collaboration with Tehnomanija further enriches the offer in the Wolt app and brings closer the vision of a “digital shopping mall” that brings together everything needed in one place. Users can now choose popular electronic devices and accessories directly in the Wolt app with easy ordering, fast delivery and reliable customer support. Interestingly, Serbia ranks fifth in the Wolt network in terms of electronics sales this year, primarily thanks to the already rich offer in this sector. With the new partnership, this offer has gained a quality supplement. The assortment now includes an even wider selection of products. In addition to small household and kitchen appliances, laptops, headphones and practical accessories, users can now even order a TV set. Delivery is fast, allowing users to easily get the device they need, whether it’s a sudden need or a last-minute gift. – The partnership with Tehnomanija is an important step on our path to making Wolt a digital shopping center. Electronics are an indispensable part of everyday life and we believe that we can offer users a unique experience that combines convenience, speed and reliability. We are pleased that we are opening a new chapter with Tehnomanija, as a leading domestic brand, and we look forward to the joint activations that are yet to come – said Djordje Davidovic, General Manager for Serbia and North Macedonia at Wolt . (Photo: Wolt) Wolt has already shown what instant electronics shopping looks like, from midnight deliveries of the latest gaming consoles to deliveries of new iPhones on the very day the sales start. Users are used to a no-wait, no-stress experience. The new partnership opens up space for even more interesting campaigns and activations, from promotions with discounts and special benefits, to special actions that accompany the upcoming big shopping seasons, including the holiday sales period. – This cooperation is a logical step for us in improving the user experience: we are combining technology and logistics to enable customers to purchase the devices they want immediately in a faster, simpler and more secure fashion. With Wolt, we expect to further expand the availability of our range and strengthen the position of a brand that is constantly adapting to market trends and needs. For consumers, this means more flexibility and comfort, from selection in the application to fast delivery, without going to the store and without waiting. In short, we are introducing a new dimension of shopping: faster, simpler and more affordable than before – said Milos Ristic, CEO of Tehnomanija . With this cooperation, Wolt shows how fast, safe and simple digital shopping can be, with just a few clicks. Starting today, users can explore Tehnomanija’s offer on the Wolt app and discover how simple it is to order their favorite devices, quickly, easily and without waiting. About Wolt Wolt is a technology company based in Helsinki, Finland, with a mission to bring joy, simplicity and earning potential to every local community. Wolt is developing a local commerce platform that connects users who want to order food, groceries or other products, with those who want to sell and deliver them. The company was founded in 2014, and in 2022 it partnered with DoorDash (NASDAQ: DASH). Today, they operate in more than 30 countries. You can find more information on the official Wolt website . Tehnomanija doo Beograd Wolt d.o.o. Tehnomanija Wolt Đorđe Davidović Miloš Ristić online shopping app digital shopping center home devices Your comment Send
content_it:
Wolt, piattaforma leader per la consegna digitale in Serbia, ha annunciato una nuova partnership con Tehnomanija per offrire un’esperienza di acquisto più rapida e semplice nel settore dell’elettronica. Gli utenti potranno ora ordinare direttamente dall’app Wolt una vasta gamma di prodotti, inclusi piccoli elettrodomestici, laptop, cuffie, accessori e persino televisori, con consegne veloci e assistenza clienti affidabile.

La Serbia si colloca al quinto posto nella rete Wolt per le vendite di elettronica nel 2024, grazie a un’offerta già ampia, ora ulteriormente arricchita dall’ingresso di Tehnomanija. Questa collaborazione rappresenta un passo concreto verso la realizzazione del progetto di Wolt di trasformarsi in un “centro commerciale digitale”.

“Questa partnership è fondamentale per rendere Wolt un vero e proprio centro commerciale digitale. L’elettronica è ormai parte integrante della vita quotidiana, e vogliamo offrire un’esperienza unica basata su comodità, rapidità e affidabilità”, ha dichiarato Đorđe Davidović, General Manager di Wolt per Serbia e Macedonia del Nord.

Milos Ristić, CEO di Tehnomanija, ha aggiunto: “Stiamo combinando tecnologia e logistica per consentire ai clienti di acquistare i dispositivi desiderati in modo immediato, sicuro e senza dover recarsi fisicamente in negozio”.

L’accordo prevede anche campagne promozionali con sconti e vantaggi speciali, in vista delle prossime stagioni di shopping, incluse le festività natalizie. Come riportato da ekapija.com, questa collaborazione amplia le opportunità per i consumatori serbi e potrebbe rappresentare un modello interessante per aziende italiane del settore elettronico e della distribuzione digitale, sempre più orientate a integrare canali di vendita innovativi e servizi di consegna rapidi.

title_en: Land being prepared for construction of new Zlatibor airport runway – Length in first phase 700 m, final 2,500 m
title_it: Pista aeroporto Zlatibor: fase iniziale 700 m
content_en: Illustration (Photo: Unsplash/Matt Bowden) The most visited Serbian mountain is striving to become a world tourist center. This is supported by the construction of an airport on Zlatibor, which will complete and round off the tourist offer. In the area where earthworks are currently being carried out, the mayor of Cajetina, Milan Stamatovic, announced the start of the implementation of the Zlatibor airport construction project. – In the first phase of the works, the runway will be about 700 meters long, in the second 1,200, and the final length will be 2.5 kilometers. Public interest has been established here and we are fighting to reserve the land of the Agricultural Combine, which has been blocked, for such purposes through public interest – said Stamatovic. According to him, the idea of building an airport on Zlatibor is more than two decades old, but only now have the conditions been created for its implementation. – Even 20 years ago, there was an idea that Zlatibor would have its own airport for small and light aircraft, but now the possibilities are much greater - a 2.5-kilometer runway will allow the landing of larger aircraft – the mayor emphasized. He added that the current works were also being used as a borrowing site for material that would be used for road construction, and that local public companies were benefiting from the works too. – The material found here is ideal for road construction, so it is currently being used for our infrastructure projects. At the same time, we are arranging and preparing the terrain for the future runway of the Zlatibor airport – said Stamatovic, adding that Uzice Roads, which was building a bypass and a recycling yard, was also participating in the works. Stamatovic said that this project was of exceptional importance for Zlatibor and that, upon completion, the airport would represent a new development opportunity not only for the tourist offer but also for the economy of the entire region. Opština Čajetina Milan Stamatović construction of airport on Zlatibor airport on Zlatibor Your comment Send
content_it: La montagna serba più visitata punta a diventare un polo turistico internazionale, grazie anche alla costruzione di un aeroporto a Zlatibor. Il sindaco di Čajetina, Milan Stamatović, ha annunciato l’avvio dei lavori per la realizzazione della pista, che nella prima fase sarà lunga 700 metri, per poi arrivare a 1.200 metri nella seconda fase e infine a 2,5 chilometri. “È stato dichiarato di interesse pubblico l’area in cui si svolgono i lavori di sbancamento; stiamo cercando di acquisire, tramite dichiarazione di pubblica utilità, i terreni dell’Azienda agricola combinata, attualmente vincolati”, ha spiegato Stamatović. L’idea di un aeroporto a Zlatibor risale a oltre vent’anni fa, ma solo ora si sono create le condizioni per realizzarla. “Allora si pensava a una struttura per velivoli leggeri; oggi una pista di 2,5 km permetterà l’atterraggio di aerei di maggiori dimensioni”, ha sottolineato il sindaco. I materiali di scavo, ideali per la costruzione stradale, vengono già impiegati in progetti infrastrutturali locali, coinvolgendo anche l’azienda “Užičke putevi”, impegnata nella realizzazione di una variante stradale e di un impianto di riciclaggio. Il progetto è considerato strategico per lo sviluppo turistico ed economico dell’intera regione, come riportato da ekapija.com. L’infrastruttura aeroportuale potrebbe offrire nuove opportunità anche per operatori italiani nel settore delle costruzioni e dei servizi aeroportuali.

title_en: Direct flight from Belgrade to Toronto from March announced

content_en: Illustration (Photo: Dabarti CGI/shutterstock.com) Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic has said that Serbia will have direct flights to Toronto from March. – We will fly to Toronto from March. We just have to resolve some details with the Canadian authorities. That’s great news for our diaspora, for our people from here. title_en: Minister: Construction of Belgrade-Nis railroad to begin next year
title_it: Ferrovia Belgrado-Niš: lavori dal 2026
content_en: Illustration (Photo: bibiphoto/shutterstock) Minister of Construction, Transport and Infrastructure of Serbia Aleksandra Sofronijevic has announced a continuation of the construction of the rail corridor 10, the Belgrade-Nis railroad, which will be 230 kilometers long. She said on TV Pink that the whole project amounted to EUR 2.77 billion thus far. Sofronijevic said that the construction would start in 2026 and that it would be split into three sections, from Belgrade, Velika Plana, Paracin and Nis, and that the construction to Nis itself was planned to last 3 to 4 years, Beta reported. Ministarstvo građevinarstva, saobraćaja i infrastrukture Republike Srbije Ministry of Construction Aleksandra Sofronijević Belgrade Niš railroad beginning of construction sections price of construction Your comment Send
content_it: La ministra serba delle Costruzioni, dei Trasporti e delle Infrastrutture, Aleksandra Sofronijević, ha annunciato che i lavori per la costruzione del Corridoio ferroviario 10, tratta Belgrado-Niš (230 km), inizieranno nel 2026. Come riportato da ekapija.com, l’investimento complessivo ammonta finora a 2,77 miliardi di euro. Il progetto sarà suddiviso in tre lotti: Belgrado-Velika Plana, Velika Plana-Paraćin e Paraćin-Niš. La realizzazione dell’intera tratta fino a Niš richiederà tra i 3 e i 4 anni. title_en: Price of free public transport in Belgrade heading toward half a billion euros a year
title_it: Trasporto pubblico gratuito a Belgrado: costo annuo a 400 milioni
content_en: (Photo: Dejan Aleksić) Pointing out how much the “free” public transport cost the city and the citizens, Nikola Jovanovic, the director of the Center for Local Self-Government, said that, in the first six months of 2025 alone, RSD 20.58 billion, or close to EUR 30 million a month, had been paid from the budget of the city of Belgrade to the transporters. – If we add to that number direct subsidies to GSP, loan servicing, rail infrastructure and the already agreed increase of the fee for private transporters, we end up with a price of EUR 400 million a year – explains Jovanovic. Jovanovic also pointed out that “there is no city in the world where a fourth of the budget is ‘eaten’ by the public transport.” – A system designed this way is pushing Belgrade toward a certain bankruptcy and burying the public finances of the capital city – concludes the director of the Center for Local Self-Government. Centar za lokalnu samoupravu Beograd JKP GSP Beograd Center for Local Self Government CLS Gradsko saobraćajno preduzeće GSP Nikola Jovanović public transport budget money Your comment Send
content_it: Nikola Jovanović, direttore del Centro per l’Autogoverno Locale, ha evidenziato il costo del trasporto pubblico gratuito per la città di Belgrado e i suoi cittadini. Nei soli primi sei mesi del 2025, dal bilancio cittadino sono stati trasferiti ai vettori 20,58 miliardi di dinari serbi, circa 30 milioni di euro al mese. “Aggiungendo a questa cifra i sussidi diretti a GSP, il servizio del debito, le infrastrutture ferroviarie e l’aumento già concordato delle tariffe per i vettori privati, si arriva a un costo annuo di 400 milioni di euro”, spiega Jovanović. Il direttore ha inoltre sottolineato che “non esiste al mondo una città in cui un quarto del bilancio venga assorbito dal trasporto pubblico”, aggiungendo che “un sistema strutturato in questo modo sta spingendo Belgrado verso il fallimento e sta compromettendo le finanze pubbliche della capitale”, come riportato da ekapija.com. L’analisi evidenzia potenziali opportunità per aziende italiane specializzate in servizi di trasporto sostenibile, efficientamento della spesa pubblica e consulenza finanziaria per enti locali.

title_en: Novi Sad–Subotica high-speed rail line to open to traffic, testing completed
title_it: Apertura linea AV Novi Sad-Subotica
content_en: (Photo: Dejan Aleksić) The third section of the high-speed railroad on the Belgrade–Subotica route, from Novi Sad to Subotica, has been intensively tested in the past two weeks and is expected to be officially opened to traffic today, RTS announced. The line is 108.1 kilometers long and will enable trains to travel at speeds of up to 200 kilometers per hour. As stated, the Novi Sad–Subotica high-speed rail line has been intensively tested in the past two weeks, which meant that Soko and other Stadler trains operated several times a day. Construction of this section began in November 2021, and the work included laying down about 273 kilometers of new tracks, including double-track and stations. Four bridges, two viaducts, 27 overpasses and 15 underpasses were built on the route. For the first time in Serbia, three eco-ducts, each 46 meters long, were also built, which will allow animals to safely cross the railway. A total of 33 culverts and 14 underpasses were built, while 302 switches were installed on the section. The works required about 8.5 million cubic meters of earthworks and 762,000 cubic meters of crushed stone. There are four stations on the newly built section between Novi Sad and Subotica – Vrbas Nova, Lovcenac, Mali Idjos, Backa Topola and Subotica. The contractor was the Chinese consortium of China Railway International and China Communications Construction Company - CHCH, with the participation of more than 200 subcontractors and suppliers from Serbia and the European Union. Dynamic testing was carried out by the German company Deutsche Bahn Systemtechnik, which confirmed in early October 2024 that the maximum speed of 200 kilometers per hour had been reached on this section. The Soko train is planned to travel between Novi Sad and Subotica in 41 minutes, while the journey between Belgrade and Subotica will take about 79 minutes. Interregio trains will operate somewhat slower - 54 minutes from Novi Sad to Subotica and about 99 minutes from Belgrade to Subotica. Today, the ceremonial opening of this section is expected to be attended by Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic with his associates and other officials, RTS reports. content_it: Il terzo tratto della ferrovia ad alta velocità sulla tratta Belgrado-Subotica, tra Novi Sad e Subotica, è stato sottoposto a test intensivi nelle ultime due settimane ed è prevista oggi la sua apertura ufficiale al traffico, secondo quanto annunciato da RTS. La linea, lunga 108,1 chilometri, consentirà ai treni di raggiungere velocità fino a 200 km/h. I test hanno visto circolare più volte al giorno i treni Soko e altri convogli Stadler. I lavori, iniziati nel novembre 2021, hanno comportato la posa di circa 273 chilometri di nuovi binari (compresi quelli a doppio binario) e la costruzione di quattro ponti, due viadotti, 27 sovrappassi e 15 sottopassi. Per la prima volta in Serbia sono stati realizzati tre ecodotti di 46 metri ciascuno per consentire il passaggio sicuro della fauna. Sono stati inoltre costruiti 33 tombini e 14 sottopassi, e installati 302 deviatoi. L’opera ha richiesto circa 8,5 milioni di metri cubi di movimento terra e 762.000 metri cubi di pietrisco. Lungo il tratto sono presenti cinque stazioni: Vrbas Nova, Lovcenac, Mali Idjos, Bačka Topola e Subotica. L’appalto è stato affidato al consorzio cinese formato da China Railway International e China Communications Construction Company, con la partecipazione di oltre 200 subappaltatori e fornitori provenienti dalla Serbia e dall’Unione Europea. I test dinamici, condotti dalla società tedesca Deutsche Bahn Systemtechnik, hanno confermato all’inizio di ottobre 2024 il raggiungimento della velocità massima di 200 km/h. Il treno Soko impiegherà 41 minuti tra Novi Sad e Subotica e circa 79 minuti tra Belgrado e Subotica, mentre i treni Interregio viaggeranno a velocità inferiori. All’inaugurazione ufficiale dovrebbero partecipare il Presidente serbo Aleksandar Vučić e altre autorità, secondo quanto riportato da ekapija.com. Questo sviluppo infrastrutturale potrebbe offrire opportunità per imprese italiane specializzate in infrastrutture e sovrastrutture per strade ferrate, in particolare nei settori di subfornitura, consulenza tecnica e fornitura di materiali.

title_en: Montenegro on its way to becoming a global destination for remote work – From Niksic to Herceg Novi, an ecosystem for digital nomads is emerging
title_it: NON PERTINENT
content_en: Illustration (Photo: Pixabay / Engin_Akyurt) In recent years, digital nomads have been changing the way the world works, working from exotic and inspiring destinations, combining work and enjoying life. The natural beauty of Montenegro, the favorable cost of living and the developing IT scene make it appear more and more often on their map. At the beginning of the year, Montenegro was ranked as the third best destination for digital nomads in the world, right after Spain and the UAE, according to the Digital Nomad Index 2025 published by VisaGuide.World. However, in order for Montenegro to fully benefit from this trend, additional campaigns and strategic support are needed . IPC Technopolis is an institution that was among the first in the country to recognize the importance of digital nomads and has been actively working on positioning Montenegro as an attractive destination for this target group for years. - Montenegro is slowly establishing itself as a destination for digital nomads, primarily thanks to its natural beauty, affordable living costs and a growing IT scene. The trend of digital nomadism in our country is still in development, but there is an increasing interest of local communities, coworking spaces and tourism actors to adapt to this global phenomenon. However, it is necessary to further educate and inform the general public and decision-makers about the possibilities that digital nomads bring, as well as to implement a large promotional campaign so that Montenegro becomes a more recognizable destination for this target group - says Jelena Popivoda from IPC Technopolis. The first coworking space in Niksic, opened in 2018, was a key step in creating the conditions for their arrival, according to our interlocutor. Today, it has 30 workplaces, a meeting room, a multimedia room, high-speed Internet and accompanying facilities. Popivoda also announces the opening of a new coworking space with 60 seats in the House of Digital Revolution , as well as coworking outdoors , where digital workers will be able to work in a natural environment. Apart from the space, Technopolis connects the local community with nomads through workshops, meetups and the international Cross Border Coworking Conference (CBCC). This year`s edition, CBCC25, will be held from October 14 to 17 in Herceg Novi, and will gather experts and digital workers from all over the world. - For the fifth year in a row, the conference is a meeting place for nomads, startups and decision-makers, and at the same time, it is a great opportunity for Montenegro to show its potential. The conference is part of the STAR project, which is funded by the European Union through the IPA III CBC Program BiH - Montenegro 2021-2027, and which Technopolis realizes in cooperation with the INTERA Technology Park from Mostar and the National Tourism Organization of Montenegro - Popivoda points out. Additionally, within the same project, Technopolis actively works with tourism operators and service providers, providing them with education and advice on how to adapt their offer to digital nomads. - This includes various trainings, recommendations for flexible accommodation packages, coworking-friendly facilities, activities and local services that meet the needs of remote workers, thus increasing their competitiveness and attractiveness of the region. Through the same project, we are organizing a residency program for digital nomads, providing them with access to coworking spaces, the possibility of professional networking and the opportunity to get to know the destination in depth, thereby contributing to the development of the community and the positioning of Montenegro as an attractive destination for nomads - Popivoda says. One of the innovations is the development of a digital platform and mobile application which will consolidate information about attractions, accommodation and activities in Montenegro and BiH, thus facilitating the planning of the stay and promoting cross-border tourism. According to our interlocutor, digital nomads bring global perspectives and experiences, and their presence can stimulate innovation, new business opportunities and the internationalization of startups, and also contribute to the development of an ecosystem that is attractive to international investors. - Through conferences, workshops and meetups, digital nomads share their knowledge and experiences which help the local community improve competitiveness, access to technologies and innovation, thus becoming active actors in the development of the startup ecosystem in Montenegro - she points out. How to brand oneself? According to the interlocutor of eKapija, Montenegro can be positioned as a destination that offers balance between work and life, combining natural beauty, quality of life and developed coworking infrastructure. - It is important to use the stories of successful digital nomads, local projects and innovative communities, but also to actively connect digital workers with local entrepreneurs and startups. Branding includes cooperation with the tourism and IT sectors, visibility in the media, digital campaigns and initiatives such as CBCC, which promote Montenegro as a recognizable and attractive destination for working and living remotely - Popivoda says. The plans of IPC Tehnopolis are aimed at the further development of coworking infrastructure and programs, community strengthening and cooperation with institutions in order to create additional incentives for the arrival of nomads. - If we manage to connect the natural beauty of Montenegro, the quality of life and modern infrastructure, we can become a globally recognized destination for working and living remotely - Popivoda concludes. Illustration (Photo: Pixabay/StockSnap) Amendments to the Law on Foreigners in parliamentary procedure According to the Ministry of Interior, 653 permits for the temporary residence of digital nomads were issued in Montenegro by February . That number became achievable thanks to changes to the Law on Foreigners that came into force in August 2022, which introduced a special visa D for digital nomads. According to the law, a digital nomad is a foreigner who is employed or performs work electronically for a foreign company or his own company that is not registered in Montenegro. The new proposal for amendments to the Law on Foreigners, currently in the parliamentary procedure, foresees additional novelties: the digitalization of visa procedures, the introduction of new bases for residence, but also stricter rules for the employment of foreigners and harmonization with EU legislation. One of the novelties is the regulation of the residence of digital nomads, who will have to submit an employment contract and proof of registration of a foreign company. Article 60a stipulates that a temporary residence permit can last up to two years, with the possibility of extending it for another two years, while a new permit is possible after a six-month break. In addition, digital nomads are allowed family reunification - spouses and children up to the age of 18 can join them during their stay in Montenegro. An additional convenience was introduced by introducing the possibility of submitting applications electronically through the information system of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, which significantly simplified the application process. title_en: SAP Business Suite Innovation Day held in Belgrade
title_it: SAP lancia Business Suite con AI a Belgrado
content_en: (Photo: Nikola Večanski) SAP recently successfully organized the SAP Business Suite Innovation Day at Sava Centar in Belgrade, where it brought together business leaders, users, and experts to explore SAP’s bold new vision for enterprise management. The event demonstrated how SAP Business Data Cloud and SAP Business AI were integrated into SAP Business Suite to deliver exceptional business value. Through expert insights and real-world user examples, it was presented how SAP innovations combined powerful cloud applications with contextual and reliable data to enable the application of artificial intelligence in solving the most demanding business challenges of the modern era. At the very beginning, the attendees were welcomed by Branislav Sekulovic, Managing Director of SAP Balkans, and Ljubica Barbulj, CEO of EneTel Solutions, announcing the topics of the meeting - Business Suite and AI, that is, SAP’s view on artificial intelligence. – Our idea is to show how SAP Business Suite combined with artificial intelligence opens up new opportunities for improving all aspects of business. Some possibilities were not even imaginable until recently – said Managing Director of SAP, Branislav Sekulovic. He later referred to both users and partners. – We see engagement from users and partners and a willingness to honestly share experiences. Every implementation comes with challenges. As a software company, we are glad to have a serious network of partners and professional services that can help and respond to every request. With each passing year, our clients and we become more mature. Expectations are clearer, goals are more precise - and together we are moving forward with SAP – said Sekulovic. (Photo: Nikola Večanski) Ljubica Barbulj, CEO of EneTel Solutions, said: – Our mission is to enable agility, efficiency and sustainable growth through innovation and SAP solutions for clients. We believe that domestic teams can implement projects of strategic importance and set new standards in digital transformation. During the first presentation - “ SAP Business Suite: Future-Readiness Starts Now. How timely strategy execution drives real business impact .” - Martin Scharmach, SVP & CRO Cloud ERP Private, MEE SAP, presented the strategy of SAP Business Suite, which integrates applications, data, and artificial intelligence into a single system. – I want to start with Belgrade, the place where rivers meet. I think it's a great symbol - where two rivers meet. What we want to achieve here is to connect innovation with artificial intelligence and with data in your company. From a Business Suite strategy perspective, we believe that the only way to get the most value out of AI is to connect it to your data - to train the AI on your data. And the only way to achieve this at scale is with SAP, because SAP runs your processes, SAP generates data, and this is the data that you can use to train your AI – Scharmach explained at the beginning of his presentation. Alexander Zaytsev, Head of BTP & BDC Customer Advisory, SAP CEE, in the presentation “ Explore SAP’s Application, Data, and AI Innovations ” talked about how we could position AI for every business process and why this was of key importance for SAP customers and partners. – True AI integration is not just adding a chatbot. It’s about how AI impacts business processes and how we can use it in the future. To achieve this, we need to provide the right data. That’s why we announced SAP Business Data Cloud earlier this year, our new system that allows us to unify data from different sources, both from the SAP environment and from non-SAP systems. We can integrate all of these components using the SAP Business Technology Platform. This is also an important point, because when we integrate different processes, we can create a single environment for all business processes. Artificial intelligence is changing the way we work. Many companies have already implemented AI solutions, and this is a positive sign. This means that we need to adopt innovations faster, because AI brings real business benefits to all users – explained Zaytsev. Migration of Telekom Srbija’s on-premise SAP system to SAP Private Cloud (Photo: Nikola Večanski) Success stories of SAP system users were also presented at this year’s conference. The most significant process of migration to SAP Private Cloud was discussed by Ivan Mijailovic, SAP Program Manager at EneTel, and Mirjana Jevtic, Head of IT Strategy and Corporate Support at Telekom Srbija, which has been using SAP solutions for more than ten years. – Telekom Srbija, a leader in the region, one of the most successful telecommunications operators in Southeast Europe, as an innovative company made the decision to migrate its SAP on-premise solutions to Private Cloud in order to provide a scalable, flexible and innovative solution, as well as long-term technical support. As regular support for the ECC solution expires in 2027, we decided to start this process in 2025 and ensure business continuity – explained Mirjana Jevtic. She added that “by using the SAP Rise Cloud service, part of the responsibility for infrastructure and security is transferred to the cloud provider.” – This significantly relieves our IT team. In addition, the cloud allows for more flexible scaling of resources and faster introduction of innovations, including AI tools and advanced analytical platforms – said Jevtic. Ivan Mijailovic pointed out that Telekom Srbija had a complex SAP IT architecture with four SAP systems and numerous integrations. – Together with SAP experts and colleagues from Telekom Srbija, we opted for a PTO approach in two phases - the first phase is the migration of existing solutions to SAP PCE (Private Cloud), and then in the second phase, the system conversion and updating to the latest S/4HANA version – Mijailovic pointed out. Telekom Srbija has also successfully implemented HR solutions, and Suzana Marovic, Head of the Human Resources Development Sector, spoke about this at the conference. Noteworthy stories also coming from Pestan and Swisslion Takovo The company Pestan, which implemented SAP in 2009, this year implemented the migration to SAP Private Cloud. – In SAP Private Cloud, we get privacy and the ability to maintain existing customized processes and integrations. It is a unique environment, where we have access to advanced SAP tools as well as faster access to innovations through regular upgrades that are automatically delivered – said Lazar Simic, Head of IT Service in Pestan. According to Natasa Adzic, IT Director of the company, Swisslion Takovo “is growing with SAP.” – We implemented SAP ERP in 2005. In 2022, we converted and were among the first to make the transition from SAP ERP on-premise environment to SAP S4HANA Private Cloud, using the “lift and shift” method, with the help of our partner - Axians Serbia – said Natasa Adzic. The conference was supported by partners: EneTel Solutions, Axians, Solving - IT Solutions and Services, Atos, MI Systems, Deloitte, B-One Solutions, Coming, Infinus and Hircunus. content_it:
A Belgrado, presso il Sava Centar, si è svolto con successo l’SAP Business Suite Innovation Day, evento dedicato alla nuova visione di SAP per la gestione aziendale, incentrata sull’integrazione tra SAP Business Suite, SAP Business Data Cloud e SAP Business AI.  

Ad aprire i lavori sono stati Branislav Sekulović, Managing Director di SAP Balkans, e Ljubica Barbulj, CEO di EneTel Solutions, che hanno presentato il tema centrale: l’uso dell’intelligenza artificiale per migliorare ogni aspetto del business. “Alcune opportunità rese possibili dall’unione tra SAP Business Suite e l’AI non erano nemmeno immaginabili fino a poco tempo fa”, ha affermato Sekulović, sottolineando il crescente livello di maturità di clienti e partner.  

Martin Scharmach, SVP & CRO Cloud ERP Private di SAP per l’area MEE, ha illustrato la strategia di SAP Business Suite, che unisce applicazioni, dati e AI in un unico sistema. “Il vero valore dell’AI si ottiene solo collegandola ai dati aziendali. SAP genera questi dati e li rende utilizzabili per addestrare modelli di intelligenza artificiale”, ha spiegato.  

Alexander Zaytsev, Head of BTP & BDC Customer Advisory per l’area CEE, ha ribadito che l’integrazione reale dell’AI non si limita all’aggiunta di chatbot, ma riguarda l’impatto sui processi aziendali, reso possibile grazie all’unificazione dei dati tramite SAP Business Data Cloud e la piattaforma SAP BTP.  

L’evento ha anche presentato casi di successo: Telekom Srbija ha avviato la migrazione del proprio sistema SAP on-premise verso il SAP Private Cloud nel 2025, anticipando la fine del supporto per ECC prevista nel 2027. L’azienda punta su scalabilità, flessibilità e accesso a strumenti AI, con una parte della gestione infrastrutturale e della sicurezza trasferita al cloud provider.  

Anche Pestan e Swisslion Takovo hanno condiviso le proprie esperienze: Pestan ha recentemente migrato su SAP Private Cloud mantenendo i processi personalizzati, mentre Swisslion Takovo, già cliente SAP dal 2005, è stata tra le prime in Serbia a passare a S/4HANA Private Cloud nel 2022 con il metodo “lift and shift”.  

L’evento è stato sostenuto da partner chiave tra cui EneTel Solutions, Axians, Solving, Atos, MI Systems, Deloitte, B-One Solutions, Coming, Infinus e Hircunus.  

Come riportato da ekapija.com, la trasformazione digitale guidata da SAP in Serbia offre opportunità per aziende italiane specializzate in soluzioni cloud, intelligenza artificiale e servizi di migrazione SAP, in un mercato in rapida evoluzione verso infrastrutture digitali avanzate.

title_en: Serbia to establish AI and cyber districts within Lozionica
title_it: Distretti AI e cyber a Belgrado
content_en: (Photo: metamorworks/shutterstock.com) Serbia is preparing to establish an AI district and a Cyber district in the eGovernment House, within the Lozionica complex, which will include representatives of the non-governmental sector, startup companies, business, science and innovation, in addition to eGovernment employees, said Mihailo Jovanovic, Director of the IT and eGovernment Office, in Lyon at the 18th International Law Enforcement Intellectual Property Crime Conference. Jovanovic presented Serbia's results in the field of information security and artificial intelligence at the panel “Identification and Mitigation of Risks from Digital and AI Threats.” He also stated that the installation of a new supercomputer in Kragujevac was underway, the performance of which was seven times stronger than the existing one. He also stated that the adoption of the new Law on Information Security, which is aligned with the European NIS2 Directive, was in the final stage, as the Bill was in the National Assembly. – In addition to the fact that this Law provides for the establishment of the Information Security Office, it also expands the sectors under regulation, redefines the status of ICT system operators and introduces the obligation of annual risk assessment and incident reporting within 24 hours – Jovanovic emphasized, the Office announced. Radovi su obuhvatili rekonstrukciju Ložionice na svih 4.800 m2, uz očuvanje prepoznatljivog izgleda, kao i vodotornja i okretnice, ali i izgradnju Kuće eUprave koja se prostire na 11.000 m2. Kuća eUprave zamišljena je kao mesto gde će zaposleni Kancelarije za IT i eUpravu zajedno sa privredom i startap zajednicom, a uz podršku stručnjaka iz oblasti nauke i tehnologije, dalje raditi na novim IT rešenjima. U Kući eUprave, kako je najavljeno, biće formirani AI distrikt, Cyber distrikt, Open data hub, kao i Digital distrikt. Kompletan kompleks prostire se na više od 23.000 m2. U Ložionici se nalazi i sala za događaje i okupljanja, kao i brojni prostori za razne aktivnosti kreativaca. content_it:
La Serbia sta allestendo un distretto dedicato all’intelligenza artificiale e un distretto per la cybersicurezza presso la Casa dell’eGovernment, all’interno del complesso Lozionica a Belgrado. Lo ha annunciato Mihailo Jovanović, direttore dell’Ufficio per le Tecnologie Informatiche e l’eGovernment, in occasione della 18ª Conferenza internazionale sul contrasto alla criminalità informatica a Lione. Il progetto prevede la partecipazione, oltre che dei dipendenti dell’eGovernment, di rappresentanti del settore non governativo, startup, imprese, scienza e innovazione.

Come riportato da ekapija.com, il complesso Lozionica – costruito originariamente come deposito locomotive nel 1925 – è stato interamente ricostruito e adattato su una superficie di 4.800 m², preservando elementi storici come il silo dell’acqua e la piattaforma girevole. È stata inoltre realizzata la Casa dell’eGovernment (11.000 m²), pensata come hub collaborativo per lo sviluppo di nuove soluzioni IT con il supporto di esperti del mondo accademico e tecnologico. Oltre ai distretti AI e cyber, saranno attivati un Open Data Hub e un Digital District, all’interno di un complesso totale di oltre 23.000 m², che ospita anche spazi per eventi e attività creative.

Jovanović ha inoltre riferito che l’installazione di un nuovo supercomputer a Kragujevac è in corso; la sua potenza sarà sette volte superiore a quella dell’attuale. È in fase finale l’adozione della nuova Legge sulla Sicurezza Informatica, allineata alla direttiva europea NIS2, attualmente in discussione presso l’Assemblea Nazionale. La legge prevede la creazione di un Ufficio per la Sicurezza Informatica, l’estensione dei settori regolamentati, la ridefinizione dello status degli operatori di sistemi ICT e l’obbligo di valutazione annuale dei rischi e di segnalazione degli incidenti entro 24 ore.

L’iniziativa apre opportunità per aziende italiane specializzate in intelligenza artificiale, cybersicurezza, infrastrutture digitali e servizi IT avanzati, interessate a collaborare con il crescente ecosistema tecnologico serbo.

title_en: Attempt at livestock smuggling in Britain: Pig hidden in suitcase
title_it: NON PERTINENT
content_en: (Photo: Tsekhmister/shutterstock.com) The British National Pig Association (NPA) has warned authorities about the growing problem of illegal pork imports. The latest report by the parliamentary Environment, Food and Rural Affairs Committee (EFRA) has revealed worrying amounts of meat and milk entering the country without any veterinary checks, writes Farmer. The situation culminated in a bizarre incident at the port of Dover, where customs officers found a whole pig hidden in a suitcase during a check. This case only confirmed the NPA’s claims that the current border control measures are insufficient and pose a serious risk to the health of livestock and the safety of domestic production. Disease risk endangering farms The association warns that the uncontrolled import of meat and dairy products can lead to the spread of dangerous animal diseases such as African swine fever or foot-and-mouth disease. Such outbreaks could cause catastrophic economic losses, as they would threaten the entire food supply chain and damage exports. According to the expert portal Agrarheute, the penalties so far have failed to stop smugglers. Tougher penalties proposed Public awareness of the risks of spreading animal diseases remains low, and many travelers are still unaware of the rules regarding which food products they are allowed to bring into the country. The parliamentary committee has therefore asked the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs to urgently present a plan to introduce tougher penalties, including immediate fines and the prosecution of repeat offenders. The NPA stresses that this is a matter of national food security and that it is necessary to step up surveillance at all border crossings to prevent another crisis in the British livestock industry. title_en: Serbian scientists sell autoimmune disease and cancer treatment for USD 1.9 billion – Sanofi buys biopharma company Dren Bio
title_it: Acquisita startup serba per terapie autoimmuni
content_en: Illustration (Photo: anawat sudchanham/shutterstock.com) Pharma-major Sanofi has acquired Serbian-founded biopharmaceutical company Dren Bio for up to USD 1.9 billion. Dren Bio is headquartered in San Francisco and it was founded by Serbian scientists. As said in a joint statement by the companies, this acquisition is a major milestone for the Serbian biotech sector and highlights the growing international recognition of innovations emerging from the region, reports bne IntelliNews. The agreement sees Sanofi acquire Dren Bio’s autoimmune disease treatment, DR-0201, a targeted bispecific myeloid cell activator. The drug, which has shown strong B-cell depletion in early clinical studies, is being investigated for a variety of autoimmune diseases and malignancies. Sanofi will pay USD 600 million upfront, with the remaining amount contingent on the drug’s clinical success, reaching up to USD 1.9 billion in total. – Deep B-cell depletion is at the frontier of treating autoimmune diseases and using the myeloid cell engager DR-0201 has the potential to elevate the treatment effect for patients, in particular patients refractory to existing treatments – said Houman Ashrafian, head of research and development at Sanofi. Founded in 2019 by Serbian scientists Nenad Tomasevic and Ivan Trifunovic, Dren Bio is a private, clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company. The name Dren reflects the company’s Serbian roots, referencing the dogwood tree, known locally for its health benefits. Tomasevic, a graduate of the Faculty of Chemistry, is recognized as one of Serbia’s most successful entrepreneurs in biotechnology. – It has been a privilege to advance our lead platform program, DR-0201, into clinical development. Sanofi, as a leader in immune depletion and immunology, is ideally positioned to realize the full potential of deep B-cell depletion and immune resetting for autoimmune patients – Tomasevic said. Dren Bio has raised several rounds of venture capital. In 2022, it announced the completion of a USD 65 million Series B financing, raised its total capital received to over USD 156 million. The Series B financing was co-led by Aisling Capital and HBM Healthcare Investments alongside several new and existing investors. B. P. content_it: Il colosso farmaceutico Sanofi ha acquisito la biotech Dren Bio, fondata da scienziati serbi, per un importo fino a 1,9 miliardi di dollari. Con sede a San Francisco e fondata nel 2019 da Nenad Tomasević e Ivan Trifunović, Dren Bio è specializzata nello sviluppo di terapie innovative per malattie autoimmuni e tumori. L’accordo prevede un pagamento iniziale di 600 milioni di dollari, con ulteriori 1,3 miliardi legati al successo clinico del farmaco DR-0201, un attivatore mirato di cellule mieloidi in grado di indurre una profonda deplezione delle cellule B. Questo approccio rappresenta una frontiera promettente, soprattutto per pazienti refrattari alle terapie esistenti. Il nome “Dren” richiama il corniolo, albero conosciuto in Serbia per le sue proprietà benefiche. La startup, che ha raccolto oltre 156 milioni di dollari di capitale, tra cui 65 milioni nel round di serie B del 2022, segna con questa operazione una pietra miliare per il settore biotech serbo, affermando la rilevanza internazionale delle sue innovazioni, secondo quanto riportato da bne IntelliNews e confermato da fonti di ekapija.com. L’operazione evidenzia opportunità per aziende italiane attive nel settore delle biotecnologie e della ricerca farmaceutica, in un contesto di crescente internazionalizzazione del comparto serbo.

title_en: New acquisition in Serbian pharma – Italians buy two Belgrade-based distributors for EUR 7 million in total
title_it: Acquisizioni nel settore farmaceutico serbo
content_en: (Photo: Pavel Kubarkov/shutterstock.com) Italian medical equipment manufacturer Svas Biosana said it has completed the acquisitions of Serbian medical device distributors Hermes Pharma and Megapharm . Svas Biosana acquired Hermes Pharma through its wholly-owned subsidiary Mark Medical for a consideration of 3.5 million euro (USD 3.8 million) plus a variable earn-out of about 250,000 euro, the company said in a press release earlier this month, reports SeeNews. The Italian firm bought Megapharm through its unit Levante HC Holding for a consideration of 3 million euro plus a variable earn-out of approximately 250,000 euro. Belgrade-based Hermes Pharma was founded in 2017. Prior to being acquired by Svas Biosana, it was fully-owned by local entrepreneur Predrag Andric, according to data from Serbia’s business registers agency. In 2024, it posted an operating revenue of 665 million dinars and a net profit of 92 million dinars, its annual financial statement showed. Founded in 2021 in Belgrade, Megapharm was wholly-owned by local entrepreneur Djordje Baic, according to data from the business registers agency. In 2024, it reported an operating revenue of 344 million dinars and a net profit of 51 million dinars, according to its annual financial report. Svas Biosana, established in 1972, has 350 employees and three production facilities in Italy. It is directly present in five countries and has 16,000 products, it says on its website. In 2021, Svas Biosana was listed on Euronext Growth Milan, a Borsa Italiana-manged market dedicated to small and medium-sized enterprises which are looking for capital to fund growth. Let us remind that, recently, another, much bigger acquisition related to the Serbian pharma sector, drew attention globally. Pharma-major Sanofi has acquired Serbian-founded biopharmaceutical company Dren Bio for up to USD 1.9 billion. Dren Bio is headquartered in San Francisco and it was founded by Serbian scientists. The agreement sees Sanofi acquire Dren Bio’s autoimmune disease treatment, DR-0201, a targeted bispecific myeloid cell activator. The drug, which has shown strong B-cell depletion in early clinical studies, is being investigated for a variety of autoimmune diseases and malignancies. B. P. Megapharm è stata rilevata tramite Levante HC Holding per 3 milioni di euro, a cui si aggiunge un ulteriore earn-out dello stesso importo. Hermes Pharma, fondata nel 2017 e precedentemente interamente posseduta dall’imprenditore serbo Predrag Andrić, ha registrato nel 2024 un fatturato operativo di 665 milioni di dinari e un utile netto di 92 milioni. Nel 2021 è stata quotata su Euronext Growth Milan. Si ricorda inoltre che recentemente Sanofi ha acquisito Dren Bio, azienda biofarmaceutica fondata da scienziati serbi con sede a San Francisco, per un controvalore fino a 1,9 miliardi di dollari. Queste operazioni evidenziano l’interesse internazionale per il comparto farmaceutico e biotecnologico con radici serbe. To clarify, on the website of the City of Belgrade, the urban project has been published, which is available for public review until April 9, where it is said that the new maternity ward will be located in Zemun, right next to the Clinical and Hospital Center Bezanijska Kosa. La nuova sede della Clinica di Ginecologia e Ostetricia (GOC) Narodni Front sarà costruita a Zemun, adiacente al Centro Clinico e Ospedaliero Bezanijska Kosa. L’attuale struttura, situata al numero 62 di via Kraljice Natalije a Belgrado, sarà sostituita da un edificio moderno di cinque piani fuori terra e due interrati, con una superficie lorda complessiva di 37.021,04 m². Il progetto urbanistico, pubblicato sul sito del Comune di Belgrado e in consultazione pubblica fino al 9 aprile, prevede un parcheggio sotterraneo con 181 posti auto.  

Il Governo serbo ha adottato a gennaio 2024 una nuova decisione di esproprio per l’area interessata, dopo quella di agosto 2023. Il progetto preliminare è stato elaborato sulla base delle indicazioni di un consulente/tecnologo esterno, in collaborazione con l’utente finale, considerando i dati previsionali su parti, interventi chirurgici e visite ambulatoriali.  

L’investitore è il Ministero degli Investimenti Pubblici della Serbia, mentre il progettista è la società Mašinoprojekt Kopring di Belgrado. La struttura, sviluppata su un’area di circa 55.000 m², riunirà tutti i reparti e i servizi tecnologici lungo un corridoio longitudinale al piano terra per ottimizzare la funzionalità.  

Le imprese italiane specializzate in infrastrutture sanitarie, sistemi tecnologici ospedalieri e costruzioni complesse potrebbero trovare opportunità di collaborazione in questo importante progetto pubblico serbo, come riportato dalla fonte ekapija.com.

title_en: MediGroup sold to Finnish Mehiläinen Group - Largest transaction in private healthcare market in Central and Eastern Europe
title_it: Acquisizione record nel settore sanitario privato
content_en: (Photo: Aleksandar Parezanović) MediGroup , the largest private health system in Serbia, together with the Regina Maria network from Romania, announced the largest transaction on the market of the private healthcare sector in Central and Eastern Europe. Namely, as it was announced, that these two systems join the Mehiläinen group, the largest private healthcare system in Finland, with more than 115 years of medical experience and a growing international presence. Mehiläinen Group acquires 100% ownership in the MediGroup and Regina Maria systems, which means the exit of the investors MidEuropa and Blue Sea Capital from the ownership structure . The transaction is said to be subject to customary regulatory approvals and it is expected to be finalized by the end of the year. - We are entering a new era, because MediGroup and Regina Maria become part of the Mehiläinen group. Since 2018, the majority owner of MidEuropa has been supporting the growth of the MediGroup system on the way to consolidating the leadership position of the largest private healthcare system in Serbia. Now, with the Mehiläinen Group's expertise and international presence, we are ready to further improve our services, introduce innovations and set new standards in health care. We are facing an important milestone that further strengthens our commitment to providing top-quality medical care across Serbia - Marijana Vasilescu, general manager of the MediGroup system, stated. The Mehiläinen Group is a healthcare system established in Finland which has been developing for 115 years and is present in five European countries. There are currently more than 890 medical institutions operating within the group employing more than 37,000 healthcare professionals. On an annual level, the group provides services to more than 2.2 million users, and in 2024, it achieved an income of EUR two billion, which represents an increase of 11.5% in relation to the previous year. - Regina Maria is one of the fastest growing and highest quality healthcare networks in Europe, led by top experts. We have been following its development for years and we are very pleased to now have the opportunity to take over the company. Its sister company MediGroup is also the leading player in its market with exceptional service quality. I am looking forward to this partnership - said Janne-Olli Järvenpää, CEO of the Mehiläinen Group. With more than 11,000 employees and associates, as well as by being present in all parts of Romania, Regina Maria stands out as a leader in the quality of medical services, continuously reaffirming commitment to medical excellence and patient safety. - We are honored that the largest healthcare system in Finland, with more than a century of experience, recognized the potential of the Romanian and Serbian medical markets. This investment reflects Mehiläinen Group's confidence in the region's economic development and represents an important signal of stability in the current financial context. At the same time, it marks an extremely important chapter in our network's history, and we are excited to enter a new phase together, in which we will continue to transform Europe's private healthcare sector, relying on strong management teams and a shared vision. We are confident that, with the support of the Mehiläinen Group, we will continue strengthening our services in Romania and Serbia. Together we are moving towards a future in which healthcare is increasingly advanced, digitized and accessible, where patient safety and medical service quality remain our top priorities - Fady Chreih, chairman of the Supervisory Board of the MediGroup system and general manager of the Regina Maria network, stated. MidEuropa, a private investment fund with a significant presence in Central and Southeastern Europe, became the majority owner of the MediGroup system in 2018, after acquiring 100% ownership of the Regina Maria system in 2015. With experience in the development of health systems, MidEuropa, as it turns out, played a key role in the expansion and strengthening of the leadership position of MediGroup and the Regina Maria system in private healthcare in the region. - We would like to thank the entire team for their dedication and enthusiasm, and to wish them much success in their further cooperation with the Mehiläinen Group, their experienced management and reputable investors - said Matthew Strassberg, partner in the MidEuropa fund and founder of the company's health services sector. This acquisition represents, as pointed out, a key step in consolidating the private health sector in Central and Eastern Europe. MediGroup occupies 17% of the market share in the private health sector in Serbia , while the Regina Maria network in Romania counts almost one million users of the health package and 13,000 corporate clients. Accordingly, it is expected that the combined expertise and resources of these health systems will further strengthen their positions on the market. content_it:
MediGroup, il più grande sistema sanitario privato in Serbia, insieme alla rete rumena Regina Maria, è stata acquisita dal gruppo finlandese Mehiläinen, leader nel settore sanitario privato in Finlandia con oltre 115 anni di esperienza. Si tratta della più grande operazione mai realizzata nel mercato della sanità privata nell’Europa centrale e orientale. Mehiläinen acquisisce il 100% delle due reti, segnando l’uscita dagli azionari dei fondi MidEuropa e Blue Sea Capital. L’operazione, soggetta alle autorizzazioni regolamentari, dovrebbe concludersi entro la fine dell’anno.

Marijana Vasilescu, amministratrice delegata di MediGroup, ha sottolineato che l’ingresso nel gruppo Mehiläinen rappresenta una nuova fase per migliorare servizi, introdurre innovazioni e innalzare gli standard sanitari in Serbia. Mehiläinen, presente in cinque Paesi europei, gestisce oltre 890 strutture con 37.000 professionisti sanitari, servendo 2,2 milioni di pazienti all’anno e generando nel 2024 un fatturato di 2 miliardi di euro (+11,5% rispetto al 2023).

Janne-Olli Järvenpää, CEO di Mehiläinen, ha espresso soddisfazione per l’acquisizione di due reti di eccellenza come Regina Maria e MediGroup. Fady Chreih, presidente del consiglio di sorveglianza di MediGroup e amministratore delegato di Regina Maria, ha definito l’operazione un segnale di fiducia nella stabilità economica della regione. MidEuropa, che aveva acquisito Regina Maria nel 2015 e MediGroup nel 2018, ha giocato un ruolo chiave nel loro sviluppo.

MediGroup detiene il 17% del mercato serbo della sanità privata, mentre Regina Maria conta quasi un milione di utenti e 13.000 clienti aziendali in Romania. L’unione delle competenze e risorse rafforzerà ulteriormente la posizione delle due reti nel settore. La transazione evidenzia un crescente interesse internazionale per i mercati sanitari dell’Europa sudorientale, aprendo nuove opportunità per collaborazioni con operatori italiani specializzati in tecnologie mediche, gestione sanitaria e servizi digitali integrati.

title_en: Mali: SCHOTT Pharma factory for production of pharmaceutical packaging to open in Jagodina
title_it: Nuovo stabilimento farmaceutico SCHOTT a Jagodina
content_en: Illustration (Photo: Dmitry Kalinovsky/shutterstock) The SCHOTT Pharma factory for the production of pharmaceutical packaging, a German investment which should enable the employment of 350 workers, will be opened in Jagodina today, stated the minister of finance in a technical mandate, Sinisa Mali. He said on TV Happy that “despite big global crises, Serbia has positioned itself as a safe investment destination,” announced the Ministry of Finance. Mali emphasized that Germany was the biggest foreign trade partner of Serbia and said that there were more than 80,000 people in over 1,000 companies with German capital. He also said that Serbia was among the top three fastest growing economies in Europe at that moment. Fotografije: Opis: SCHOTT Pharma povećava svoju konkurentnost u oblasti rešenja za pakovanje injekcionih lekova i ovo je najveći pogon za proizvodnju ampula u Evropi. Nova fabrika u Jagodini proizvodiće farmaceutske staklene ampule za skladištenje injekcionih lekova kao što su lekovi protiv bolova, protivupalni analgetici i anestetici. content_it: Oggi verrà inaugurato a Jagodina lo stabilimento SCHOTT Pharma per la produzione di confezioni farmaceutiche, un investimento tedesco destinato a creare 350 posti di lavoro, ha dichiarato il ministro delle Finanze in regime di mandato tecnico, Siniša Mali. Intervenendo alla televisione Happy, Mali ha affermato che “nonostante le gravi crisi globali, la Serbia si è affermata come destinazione sicura per gli investimenti”, secondo quanto riportato dal Ministero delle Finanze. Ha inoltre sottolineato che la Germania è il principale partner commerciale estero della Serbia, con oltre 1.000 aziende a capitale tedesco che danno lavoro a più di 80.000 persone. Mali ha ricordato inoltre che la Serbia figura tra le prime tre economie con la crescita più rapida in Europa. Il nuovo impianto di Jagodina produrrà fiale in vetro per la conservazione di farmaci iniettabili, come antidolorifici, antinfiammatori e anestetici, e rappresenta il più grande stabilimento per la produzione di ampolle in Europa, rafforzando la competitività di SCHOTT Pharma nel settore delle soluzioni per il packaging dei medicinali. Come riportato dalla fonte mediatica ekapija.com, questa iniziativa offre interessanti opportunità di collaborazione per le aziende italiane operanti nel settore farmaceutico e nella fornitura di materiali per il packaging sanitario.

title_en: Reconstruction of Children’s Dispensary in Leskovac announced – Investment worth EUR 5.7 million
title_it: Ristrutturazione del dispensario pediatrico di Leskovac
content_en: (Photo: Google Street View) The Service for Health Protection of Children and School Children of the Health Center Leskovac will get a whole new look in the next two years, with an investment worth close to RSD 670 million, that is, around EUR 5.7 million, without the VAT. The funds are secured through cooperation between the City of Leskovac and the Ministry of Public Investment, which is financing the majority of the project – RSD 496 million, whereas the local self-government is setting aside RSD 172.1 million. As the mayor of Leskovac, Goran Cvetanovic, announced while visiting the facility, the reconstruction entails the extension and expansion of the existing facility of the Children’s Dispensary, which will have three floors following the execution of the works . The new floor of 1,665 m2 will be meant for the preventive section , and the facility will be equipped with new furniture and modern medical equipment. On a parcel of 3,770 m2, 27 parking spaces will be secured as well – 12 for the employees, 13 for the users and 2 for persons with disabilities. The energy efficiency of the facility will be improved as well, including a full replacement of the joinery. During the works, the service will be temporarily moved to the outpatient clinic no. 3, also known as the former covid outpatient clinic. Novi sprat površine 1.665 m? biće namenjen preventivnom delu. Na parceli površine 3.770 m? biće obezbeđeno i 27 parking mesta – 12 za zaposlene, 13 za korisnike i 2 za osobe sa invaliditetom. content_it: Nei prossimi due anni, il Servizio per la protezione della salute dei bambini e degli studenti del Centro sanitario di Leskovac sarà oggetto di una ristrutturazione completa, con un investimento di circa 670 milioni di dinari serbi (circa 5,7 milioni di euro, IVA esclusa). I fondi provengono da un accordo tra la Città di Leskovac e il Ministero degli Investimenti Pubblici della Repubblica di Serbia, che finanzia la maggior parte del progetto con 496 milioni di dinari, mentre l’amministrazione locale destina ulteriori 172,1 milioni di dinari. Secondo quanto annunciato dal sindaco di Leskovac, Goran Cvetanović, durante una visita alla struttura, l’intervento prevede l’ampliamento dell’attuale edificio del dispensario pediatrico, che passerà a tre piani. Il nuovo piano, di 1.665 m², sarà dedicato alle attività preventive e sarà dotato di nuovi arredi e di attrezzature mediche moderne. Sul terreno di 3.770 m² saranno inoltre realizzati 27 posti auto: 12 per il personale, 13 per gli utenti e 2 per le persone con disabilità. Sarà migliorata anche l’efficienza energetica dell’edificio, con la sostituzione completa degli infissi. Durante i lavori, il servizio sarà temporaneamente trasferito presso l’ambulatorio n. 3, ex ambulatorio anti-Covid. Come riportato da ekapija.com, l’occasione potrebbe rappresentare opportunità per aziende italiane specializzate in edilizia sanitaria, arredi medicali e tecnologie per l’efficienza energetica.

title_en: Serbian startup Vinaver Medical receives investment for revolutionary oncology software
title_it: Startup serba in oncologia riceve investimento
content_en: Illustration (Photo: everything possible/shutterstock.com) The Digital Serbia Initiative’s business angel network has invested in Vinaver Medical , a domestic startup that develops software solutions for improving medical diagnostics and treatment planning in oncology using artificial intelligence and spectral CT technology. As announced by the Digital Serbia Initiative, the founding team of Vinaver Medical combines knowledge from physics, engineering and artificial intelligence to exploit the full potential of clinical CT diagnostics. Their proprietary software, which can be integrated into existing systems regardless of the manufacturer, has proven to be a powerful tool for tissue characterization in the field of cardiac and abdominal diagnostics, with the greatest impact in the field of particle radiotherapy. When planning the most modern forms of radiotherapy, it is extremely important to precisely know the density and composition of the tissue through which radiation passes before reaching the tumor. Vinaver Medical’s software extracts precisely this information from the CT scan with a high level of accuracy, thus enabling better planning and safer delivery of therapy. – The investment we received from DSI business angels is a confirmation that there is room for the development of high-tech solutions from Serbia with application in global medicine. We will direct the funds to support patent protection, implementation of ISO standards and the process of obtaining the FDA 510(k) certificate. In addition to financial support, we greatly appreciate the mentoring and strategic support we are receiving from the angels, and we believe that with their experience and contacts we will accelerate the entry of our product into new markets – said Stevan Vrbaski, founder and director of Vinaver Medical. The Vinaver Medical solution improves the work of all the actors in the healthcare system - from clinicians, through hospital administration to insurers - and brings the greatest benefit to cancer patients. By enabling more precise and personalized therapy planning, the software contributes to the essential goal of modern radiotherapy: curing cancer with minimal or no side effects. Their product is already being tested in cooperation with clinics in the region as well as in the US and EU markets, and they are also actively present in the domestic healthcare system, thus directly contributing to the quality of treatment of patients in Serbia. The Digital Serbia Initiative Business Angel Network brings together more than 50 successful entrepreneurs and leaders from various fields. Since its establishment, the network has invested EUR 1.3 million in 13 domestic startups, providing them with smart capital - financial, mentoring and strategic support in the early stages of development. – Vinaver Medical is a great example of a startup that combines scientific knowledge, market potential and a strong team. Their approach solves specific problems in modern medicine and we believe that they have the potential for global success – said Zorana Brankovic, Member of the Executive Board and Chief Operating Officer (COO) of Banca Intesa and a member of the Business Angel Network. content_it: La rete di business angel dell’iniziativa Digital Serbia ha investito in Vinaver Medical, startup serba che sviluppa software per migliorare la diagnosi e la pianificazione terapeutica in oncologia, sfruttando l’intelligenza artificiale e la tecnologia CT spettrale. Il team fondatore unisce competenze in fisica, ingegneria e intelligenza artificiale per sfruttare appieno il potenziale della diagnostica TC clinica. Il software proprietario, integrabile in qualsiasi sistema indipendentemente dal produttore, si è dimostrato efficace nella caratterizzazione dei tessuti, soprattutto in ambito cardiaco e addominale, con un impatto significativo nella radioterapia con particelle. La soluzione estrae con elevata precisione, dalle scansioni TC, informazioni cruciali sulla densità e composizione dei tessuti attraversati dalla radiazione, consentendo una pianificazione più accurata e una somministrazione più sicura della terapia. “L’investimento ricevuto conferma che esiste spazio per soluzioni high-tech sviluppate in Serbia con applicazione nella medicina globale. I fondi saranno destinati alla protezione brevettuale, all’implementazione degli standard ISO e all’ottenimento della certificazione FDA 510(k)”, ha dichiarato Stevan Vrbaški, fondatore e direttore di Vinaver Medical, sottolineando anche il valore del supporto strategico e di mentoring fornito dagli investitori. Il software migliora l’efficienza di tutti gli attori del sistema sanitario e offre il massimo beneficio ai pazienti oncologici, permettendo terapie più precise e personalizzate, con l’obiettivo di curare il cancro minimizzando gli effetti collaterali. La soluzione è già in fase di testing con cliniche nella regione, negli Stati Uniti e nell’Unione Europea, ed è attivamente utilizzata nel sistema sanitario serbo. La rete di business angel di Digital Serbia, composta da oltre 50 imprenditori e leader, ha investito finora 1,3 milioni di euro in 13 startup nazionali. “Vinaver Medical è un esempio eccellente di startup che coniuga conoscenza scientifica, potenziale di mercato e un team solido, con concrete prospettive di successo globale”, ha affermato Zorana Branković, COO di Banca Intesa e membro della rete. La presenza di una tecnologia medica avanzata sviluppata in Serbia, già in fase di validazione internazionale, rappresenta una potenziale opportunità per aziende italiane attive nel settore della salute e della diagnostica avanzata.
